intro: Pycnocoma thollonii, commonly known as the Madagascar mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are typically leathery and evergreen, adapting to the cool, humid conditions of its high-altitude habitat. Pycnocoma thollonii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and its role in the specialized ecosystems of Madagascar.
